page.title: 10Transport about Llangunllo
page.content: Llangunllo station, now unmanned, lies 1\ miles to the north up a steep hill, just outside the survey area. Three Heart of Wales line trains in either direction stop each day.School children are bussed to Presteigne (secondary) and to Whitton (primary). The 13 mile journey includes a detour to Bleddfa because of the cuts in school transport.The journey takes forty minutes.A bus leaves the village at 10:30 am on Thursday, to Knighton Market.It returns at 2:30 pm. A car is a necessity here not a luxury.People without cars are dependent on others kindness.It is impossible, for example, to visit people in Hereford hospital by public transport.A bad winter forces us all to rely on farmers with tractors to get basic supplies.
